section.p: The act of creating immunity usually against a particular disease <immunization against smallpox>; especially : treatment of an organism for the purpose of making it immune to subsequent attack by a particular pathogen Source: Merriam-Webster's Medical Dictionary, 2002 Merriam-Webster, Inc.

ol.li:
Contains exactly one [1..1] category with data type Code
What the immunization is for

Contains exactly one [1..1] contraIndication with data type Boolean
ContraIndicated is the indicator if this immunization should be continued or should be stopped due to an adverse reaction being opserved.

Contains exactly one [1..1] date with data type Point In Time
The date and time the immunization was given.

Contains exactly one [1..1] id with data type Id
Unique id given to the immunization test

Contains exactly one [1..1] series with data type Code
Indicates which type of series the patient has been given. Current valid values are Series 1 through 8, Partially complete, booster, or complete

Contains zero or one [0..1] reaction, where its type is Observed Reaction
The response of cells or tissues to an antigen, as in a test for immunization
The response of cells or tissues to an antigen, as in a test for immunization
Contains exactly one [1..1] subject, where its type is Patient

Contains exactly one [1..1] visit, where its type is Outpatient Visit
An encounter for the patient at one site within a specifie length of time.
Contains exactly one [1..1] author, where its type is Author
